page.title: 15Sir John Gooch's Estate
page.content:
Sir John Gooch's home is big and very beautiful. There are beautiful carvings and nice furniture. Growing on the house is ivy. Amanda Starbuck
The house is called Benacre Hall. Sir John lives there alone because his father, Sir T.S. Gooch, has died and his wife is also dead. There are stables at the back of the house. At the front door there are four pillars made of stone. In fact the whole house is made of stone except for the doors and the windows.The front door is a double door and when it is open it leaves a big space. Our school has one of his talbots above the main door. Janet Liddell
